channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Tests Positive for the Coronavirus, and Senators Berate Secret Service Chief
item.description: Plus, a plunge in the Seine ahead of the Olympics.

item.title: Evan Gershkovich, Wall Street Journal Reporter, Returns to Court in Russia
item.description: The hearing was the second in the espionage trial of Mr. Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal. The United States and The Journal have strongly rejected the charge against him.

item.title: Jamie Dimon welcomes complaining JPMorgan clients: ‘If we’re torturing you, we’re probably torturing another 100,000 people’
item.description: The Wall Street Titan said that he welcomes criticisms because they help open his eyes and ears.

item.title: As Clouds Gather Over Europe, Leaders Seek Unity in Churchill’s Birthplace
item.description: More than 40 European leaders, including President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine, are meeting at Blenheim Palace on Thursday. Fears over the continent’s security, and the threat of Russia, loom large.

item.title: Live Election Updates: Trump to Close Convention in Full Control of His Party
item.description: Former President Donald J. Trump will address the final day of the Republican convention, delivering his first major televised speech since the assassination attempt on Saturday.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says whoever is elected president can’t sit in denial and must realize ’we have a problem’ with national debt
item.description: "We shouldn't be forced to by the market—that would be the worst way to go."

item.title: French Lawmakers Will Vote to Elect New National Assembly President
item.description: Lawmakers gathered for the first time since an election produced a deadlocked Parliament to elect a new president of the National Assembly. It was unclear who would come out on top.

item.title: The Myth of Migrant Crime
item.description: Republicans suggest that immigrants are especially likely to be criminals. The data shows the opposite.

item.title: Reliable GPS is coming to an end—but new quantum technologies could show the path forward
item.description: GPS has become so ubiquitous in our daily lives that we hardly think about what happens when it’s not available.

item.title: Why Is Venezuela’s President, Nicolás Maduro, on the Ballot 13 Times?
item.description: President Nicolás Maduro will appear over and over again on Venezuela’s presidential ballot. That is by design, government critics say.

item.title: America’s Allies in Middle East See Some Advantages in Potential 2nd Trump Presidency
item.description: As Republicans meet this week for their convention, leaders in Israel, Saudi Arabia and Egypt are considering what a second Trump presidency could mean for their domestic and regional agendas.

item.title: 80-year-old L.L. Bean bag originally meant to carry ice finds a new audience as a must-have summer fashion accessory
item.description: New Yorker Gracie Wiener helped get it started by ordering her humble bags from L.L. Bean monogrammed with “Psycho” and then “Prada,” and posting about them on Instagram.

item.title: WNBA Players Seek Expert Advice as They Assess Next Union Contract
item.description: With the league’s popularity rising, players have never had more leverage when it comes to issues like salaries, travel accommodations and revenue sharing.

item.title: An Algorithm Told Police She Was Safe. Then Her Husband Killed Her.
item.description: Spain has become reliant on an algorithm to score how likely a domestic violence victim may be abused again and what protection to provide — sometimes leading to fatal consequences.

item.title: Amazon is sitting on a Gen-Z goldmine that could be worth $46 billion – and it’s not movies or Prime
item.description: The popular streaming platform gives Amazon access to an advertising market it would otherwise bypass.
